answers.answer: Thirst is a hallmark of diabetes. Before the development of insulin diabetic patients would crave gallons of milk and water a day. When there is insufficient insulin the body starts using an alternative to bring glucose levels down. It doesn't work very well, but requires a great deal of fluid to wash out the glucose. This, in turn, causes thirst.
